data.title: Texas A&M University
data.meta_description: Home page for Texas A&M University - Central Texas, a proud member of the Texas A&M University System and the most affordable public university in Central Texas.
data.text:
“I’m from a very, very rural area in Arkansas, and so most of the professional women I came in contact with as a little girl were teachers, so I wanted to be a teacher,” Amy Mersiovsky recalls. But life had other plans.

The Department of Education plans to have a fully functional 2025-26 FAFSA system available to applicants on or before December 1, 2024, following a phased rollout and user testing period with a limited set of students and institutions that will begin on October 1, 2024. Learn more.

Charles "Chuck" Simmons is a 79-year young student finally completing the undergraduate degree he started more than five decades ago.

In the 1970s, as a Houston police officer and a devoted family man, Chuck's academic journey at Sam Houston State University was challenging, involving a strenuous three-hour drive from Houston to Huntsville three times a week. Despite these hurdles, his love for learning never waned, but circumstances led him to pause his educational pursuits. This May, Chuck will walk the stage at The Cadence Bank Center at the A&M-Central Texas Spring 2024 May Commencement, receiving his degree in criminal justice, making him the University's oldest graduate. #15StoriesOfImpact

Read more about his story here.

Samuel Schmidt story is a tale of resilience, transformation, and dedication.

From the electrifying stages of metal bands as a roadie to the disciplined ranks of the U.S. Army, and now a guardian in the field of cybersecurity, Sam's path truly exemplifies the Warrior ethos — tackling challenges head-on and emerging victorious with a renewed mission in life. Discover how Sam Schmidt leveraged his experiences and education at Texas A&M University-Central Texas to safeguard our digital frontiers. #15StoriesOfImpact

Read more about his story here.

Despite his troubled youth and a life sentence at 18, Korey Henderson transformed into a dedicated student earning his Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from Texas A&M University-Central Texas through the prison education program.

With aspirations to start his own landscaping and horticulture business upon release and a desire to mentor troubled youth, Henderson prepares for a future beyond bars with the unwavering support of his wife, Mary, and dedicated educators like Dr. Fulmore and Mr. Moore.

Read more about Korey's story.

Despite facing the daunting challenge of balancing parenthood and education, Alexis has not let her circumstances define her. Her pursuit of a degree in sociology with a minor in psychology is driven by a deep-seated desire to inspire not just her children, but others who might feel limited by their situations.

Through her dedication, she aims to pave a path of opportunity for her children and teach them that limitations only exist if we allow them.

Read more about her story.

Kernisha, who began her academic pursuits at Central Texas College, has always been a beacon of determination and excellence. Through her studies in the Master of Science in Leadership for Sustainability program at A&M-Central Texas, she has honed her skills to meet the challenges of today’s educational landscape, focusing on sustainability and community engagement.

Now, as she takes the helm at Palo Alto Middle School, Kernisha is poised to inspire a new generation of students, instilling in them the values of hard work, leadership, and environmental stewardship.

Read more about her story.

Kathleen’s story weaves through decades of unwavering commitment to education. Whilst a respected staff member at Central Texas College, she championed degree completion for countless students. Yet, it was her turn to shine in the pomp and circumstance of her own commencement, making a profound moment of personal and academic triumph at Texas A&M University-Central Texas.

From her first steps in higher education to the momentous day she crossed the stage with her graduate degree, her resilience and gratitude remain the same. Her passion for film studies continues to spark her curiosity and drive her forward, potentially towards a doctorate that blends her love for the arts with her academic pursuits.

Read more about her story.

Margarita’s educational journey at A&M-Central Texas laid the groundwork for her to rise as a champion of the “Triple Bottom Line,” harmonizing people, planet, and profit. Through hands-on fieldwork and an unwavering commitment to the United Nations’ 17 Sustainable Development Goals and her work with the Arizona Conservation Corps, she embodies the change she seeks, inspiring others to preserve our natural world and make a lasting impact for generations to come.

Read more about her story.

From a childhood on Long Island’s shores to the disciplined life of military service and eventually a single parent, Crystal turned each obstacle into an opportunity.

With her degree from Texas A&M University-Central Texas in hand, Crystal has now taken the courageous step to further her passion in social work at Baylor University, inspiring others to believe it is never too late to chase their dreams.

Read more about her story.

Karola Anthony’s journey from navigating childhood without her mother to becoming a trailblazer in the business world through self-taught mastery of accounting, English, and her role as the first woman auditor at Lott, Vernon & Company, P.C. embodies the true spirit of dedication.

With that same relentless drive, Karola chose to give back to her community and its academic future, establishing an endowed scholarship at Texas A&M University-Central Texas titled ‘The Globe Chapter-Karola Anthony Scholarship,’ providing a $1,000 annual award to assist students in achieving their academic dreams, starting Fall 2019.

Read more about her story.

From the vibrant coasts of Puerto Rico to the classrooms of Central Texas, Julissa has overcome life’s hurdles as a single parent, transforming each challenge into a stepping stone toward her calling as a cherished ESL and Reading teacher at Roy J. Smith Middle School. While pursuing her M.Ed. in educational leadership at A&M-Central Texas, Julissa was honored as the recipient of the prestigious ‘We Teach Texas Leadership Fellow Scholarship,’ setting her on a path to amplify her impact on future generations. #15StoriesOfImpact

Read more about Julissa.
